item.title: China Stocks Rise to 2025 High, LME Copper Falls: Markets Wrap
item.description: Chinese shares are on course for their best close in three years as investors speculate about more measures to ease deflationary pressures and stimulate the economy. Copper futures fell in London on President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threat.
item.dc:creator: Anand Krishnamoorthy, Winnie Hsu

item.title: Oil Steadies as Industry Report Points to Gain in US Stockpiles
item.description: Oil steadied as traders weighed signs of swelling US crude stockpiles and the fallout from President Donald Trump’s tariff regime.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Lua

item.title: ICICI Prudential Asset Files for $1.2 Billion India IPO
item.description: ICICI Prudential Asset Management Co., India’s second-largest mutual fund manager by assets, filed preliminary documents for what could be the country’s second-biggest initial public offering this year.
item.dc:creator: Rajesh Mascarenhas

item.title: China’s AI Bet Rises From the Gobi Desert
item.description: In a remote part of China’s northwestern Xinjiang region, dozens of data centers rise from the desert. A Bloomberg analysis of documents and company filings found Chinese companies plan to buy more than 115,000 high-tech Nvidia chips - chips the US has banned from being exported to China - to power these centers. K. Oanh Ha discusses the story on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: New Tariff Threats Should Be a Big Deal. They're Not
item.description: The risk is that too much ho-hum in the markets could be inflating the Trump Put.
item.dc:creator: John Authers

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump during a cabinet meeting at the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, July 8, 2025. Trump said his administration is weighing whether to take control of the city of Washington, DC, to help combat crime, in a move that would represent a dramatic upheaval to the capital’s half-century of home rule. Photographer: Aaron Schwartz/CNP

item.title: Surging UK Shipping Costs Threaten to Deliver a New Price Shock
item.description: The cost of shipping goods from China to the UK has surged due to ripple effects of the US trade war, threatening to push up consumer prices and complicate the Bank of England’s plan to keep nudging down interest rates.
item.dc:creator: Irina Anghel

item.title: Gearbox Maker Renk Is Said to Mull Options for Civilian Business
item.description: Renk Group AG is considering options for its civilian industrial business, according to a person familiar with the matter, as the German gearbox maker looks to focus on its defense operations.
item.dc:creator: Laura Alviz, Eyk Henning

media:content.media:description: Photo by Stefan Puchner/picture alliance via Getty Images) Photographer: picture alliance/dpa/picture alliance

item.title: Rubio, Asean Ministers to Attend Malaysia Summit Amid Trump's Tariff Threats
item.description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio is heading to an Asean summit in Malaysia, where he is set to discuss security issues in the Indo-Pacific region. But, as Bloomberg's Minmin Low reports, his trip will likely be overshadowed by President Trump's latest tariff threats. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: The Asia Trade 9/7/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: New World Seeks to Sell China Real Estate Assets After Loan Deal
item.description: New World Development Co. is seeking to divest real estate projects in mainland China after pulling off an $11 billion refinancing deal in June, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: John Liu

item.title: JPMorgan Says China’s Crackdown on Overcapacity May Boost Stocks
item.description: Policies in China that are aimed at curbing excess capacity may be positive for equities and global trade if executed right, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.
item.dc:creator: Hoi Yuet Woo

item.title: Fujitsu Shares Slump as UK Demands Post Office Compensation Plan
item.description: Fujitsu Ltd. shares dropped the most since April in Tokyo after the chair of a UK public inquiry called for the firm to release a compensation plan for victims of the Post Office scandal by the end of October.
item.dc:creator: Alice French, Kentaro Tsutsumi

item.title: Asia Trade Chiefs Travel 800 Hours to Secure Elusive US Deals
item.description: Trade negotiators from around the world have been racking up miles flying to Washington to strike a deal with President Donald Trump — especially Asian delegations who have the farthest to go. With final agreements still out of reach for most, the travel isn’t slowing down anytime soon.
item.dc:creator: Katia Dmitrieva, Erica Yokoyama, Shruti Srivastava

media:content.media:description: Ryosei Akazawa on June 1. Photographer: Kyodo News/Kyodo News

item.title: Copper Market in Turmoil as Trump Touts 50% Tariff on US Imports
item.description: US President Donald Trump sowed fresh chaos in metals markets with news of a higher-than-expected 50% tariff on copper imports, spurring a record spike in US futures and a drop in the global benchmark.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Zhou

item.title: Indian Stock Market Braces for Volatile Session After Fresh Copper, Pharma Tariffs
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

item.title: Hunter Point CEO on the PE Investor Pivot
item.description: Last month, Hunter Point Capital agreed to acquire a 16% stake in Equitix, an international infrastructure investor and fund manager, at an implied enterprise value of £1.3 billion, excluding net debt. Since the deal, Equitix's portfolio has grown to nearly $16 billion in assets under management. CEO and co-Founder Avi Kalichstein joined Wall Street Beat on Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about the partnership. (Corrected guest name and title) (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Australian Over-50s Village Operator’s Stock Drops on Fee Ruling
item.description: Lifestyle Communities Ltd. shares tumbled the most in 16 years after an Australian state tribunal ruled that some of the retirement village operator’s exit fee agreements should be scrapped.
item.dc:creator: Carmeli Argana

item.title: Indonesia’s 560-Times Oversubscribed IPO Jumps on Stock Debut
item.description: PT Chandra Daya Investasi shares surged as much as 35% in their first day of trading in Jakarta, hitting the daily limit, on optimism they will follow the stellar gains made by other companies linked with billionaire Prajogo Pangestu.
item.dc:creator: Prima Wirayani

item.title: Great Eastern to Resume Trading as Delisting Bid Fails
item.description: Great Eastern Holdings Ltd.’s shares are expected to resume trading in Singapore, after the insurer failed to win enough shareholder support for its delisting plan that was backed by Oversea-Chinese Banking Corp.
item.dc:creator: Chanyaporn Chanjaroen, Gabrielle Ng

item.title: Hospital Operator IHH Eyes Indonesia, Vietnam for Expansion
item.description: IHH Healthcare Bhd. is looking to potential new markets Indonesia and Vietnam as the Malaysian hospital operator continues building scale to offset rising healthcare costs in the region.
item.dc:creator: Ram Anand

media:content.media:description: Prem Kumar Nair Photographer: Samsul Said/Bloomberg

item.title: Henderson Land Shares Tumble After $1 Billion Convertible Sale
item.description: Henderson Land Development Co. shares fell by the most in nearly four years after the property developer secured HK$8 billion ($1 billion) from the sale of convertible bonds.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti

item.title: Australia Rate Shock Puts RBA’s Radio Silence Under Scrutiny
item.description: In the seven weeks leading up to the Australian central bank interest rate decision Tuesday, its policymakers sat silent as hot wars in the Middle East and trade wars from the US shook global confidence.
item.dc:creator: Swati Pandey

media:content.media:description: Michele Bullock speaks during a press conference in Sydney, Australia, on Tuesday, July 8, 2025.

item.title: Hong Kong Bank Borrowing Rise May Signal Tighter Liquidity
item.description: Overnight borrowing by Hong Kong banks jumped to the highest in almost five months, a sign that a series of interventions to bolster the local currency may be having a desired effect on the money market.
item.dc:creator: Masaki Kondo, Julia Zhong

item.title: US Copper Prices Surge to Record as Trump Calls for 50% Tariff
item.description: Copper futures in New York surged after US President Donald Trump said he planned to implement a 50% tariff on imports, a move that’s likely to spark massive supply-chain ripples through global metal markets.
item.dc:creator: Doug Alexander, James Attwood

item.title: Gold Holds Decline as Extended US Negotiations Ease Trade Fears
item.description: Gold held a decline after President Donald Trump said the new August deadline for the start of so-called “reciprocal” tariffs won’t be delayed, with nations expected to use the extended window to continue negotiating with the US.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross

item.title: S&P 500 IS ROUGHLY FLAT | The Close 7/8/2025
item.description: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Abby Yoder J.P. Morgan Private Bank, Matthew Luzzetti Deutsche Bank, Scott Dresser Amazon Robotics, Ed Ludlow, Bloomberg Tech, Jay Woods Freedom Capital Markets, Sara Hsu University of Tennessee at Knoxville, Matt Maley Miller Tabak, Ralph Schlosstein Evercore and Jason Warner Poolside. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: London Must Drop Listing ‘Snobbishness’ to Fix Decline, CBI Says
item.description: The UK should stop looking down on companies seeking a secondary listing in London if it wants to rebuild the stock exchange’s waning status, the leader of one of the country’s main corporate lobby groups said.
item.dc:creator: Sabah Meddings

item.title: UK Trial by Jury Faces Axe for Serious Financial Crime Cases, Judge Says
item.description: The UK criminal justice system is set for its biggest shakeup in decades after a government ordered review recommended getting rid of jury trials in complex white collar crime.
item.dc:creator: Upmanyu Trivedi

item.title: Morningstar Says Korean Stocks Are EM’s Best Bet Despite Tariffs
item.description: A fund manager at Morningstar Wealth is selling Chinese and Japanese equities to increase exposure to South Korea, which he’s betting on to provide the best returns in both emerging and Asian markets over the next decade.
item.dc:creator: Selcuk Gokoluk, Daedo Kim

item.title: Why tariffs are the biggest issue for the US economy
item.description: Lanhee Chee of Hoover Institution joins Bloomberg "The Close" to discuss potentially new tariffs, 50% on copper, maybe 200% on pharmaceuticals. (Source: Bloomberg)
